alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 1:20PM CDT until May 07 at 8:43AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas and Missouri... Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County. Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. .Heavy rainfall expected over the next 24 hours combined with saturated soils and elevated streamflow will lead to rivers rising above flood stage across the Little Osage and lower Marmaton Basins. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 38.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 43.4 feet Wednesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Tuesday afternoon at 130 PM CDT.
